One such tool that has been a favorite of students, business professionals, and creative minds for a long time is **Microsoft's OneNote**.


However, with the ever-changing landscape of technology, it's always good to have various options. So, if you're looking for something **fresh and innovative in 2023**, you're in luck! We've covered you with a list of the **6 best OneNote alternatives** worth exploring!

## What is Microsoft OneNote?



![Bdj_MbaZAeJGHA2pjr6fqgMcfSACdzxUBbtEsrRpmuI=](https://app.affine.pro/api/workspaces/qf73AF6vzWphbTJdN7KiX/blobs/Bdj_MbaZAeJGHA2pjr6fqgMcfSACdzxUBbtEsrRpmuI=)


**Microsoft OneNote**: It is a fantastic digital note-taking app that lets you capture and organize all your ideas, notes, and information in one convenient place. With OneNote, you can easily keep track of everything from your daily to-do list to your most creative ideas. It offers a range of powerful organizational tools, including page tabs, tags, to-do lists, and formatting options for text and tables. In addition, you can even record audio notes to capture essential meetings or lectures.


**Features:**


* Take notes in various formats, including text, images, audio, and video.


* A powerful search function that can search across all of your notes, making it easy to find specific information.


* Highly customizable


* Integrates seamlessly with other Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).


**Pros of OneNote:**


* A highly versatile note-taking tool that can be used for various purposes, from personal note-taking to business collaboration.


* Available on a wide range of devices, including desktops, laptops, tablets, and smartphones, making it easy to access your notes from anywhere.


**Limitations of OneNote:**


* Can’t buy it individually.


* Require a Microsoft Office 365 plan


* Limited integration with other apps


* Limited search functionality


**Pricing:**


* OneNote is free as part of the Microsoft Office suite of applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and more.


* Microsoft 365 pricing starts at $5 per user per month.
